Grouped_Utterances: I've been okay, I guess. Trying to stay positive despite some financial stress.  Yes, there was a day I was feeling really down about money, and she took me out for a walk. Just being outside helped a lot.  Definitely. It reminded me that there are things outside of my worries that I can enjoy.  I’ve been listening to music more. It really helps me relax and forget about things for a while.  I haven't really, but that’s a good idea. I used to write songs when I was feeling low.  A few, but they haven’t been as frequent.  I think focusing on the good things in my life has helped.  I’ve been trying to be more aware of it. I still struggle, but I’m working on it.  Yes, there was a minor argument with my girlfriend about household chores.  It felt good. I didn’t want to escalate things.  Mostly when I feel overwhelmed.  I’m trying to see them as opportunities for growth rather than obstacles.  I feel proud. It’s not easy, but I’m trying.
She's been really supportive, reminding me to focus on what I can control.

Yeah, I've tried to go for walks more often.  I took a deep breath and tried to communicate calmly instead of reacting.  I’ve been trying to break tasks down into smaller steps.  It’s made things feel more manageable, which is nice.

I want to work on my emotional responses and maybe explore songwriting again.  Those sound like meaningful goals. We can definitely incorporate songwriting into our sessions.  How about we set a goal for you to write a short song or poem about your feelings for next time?  I can do that!
